int-org-section.heading: Religion

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: ACER-MJO (l'Action Chrétienne des Etudiants Russes—Mouvement de Jeunesse Orthodoxe)

address.verbatim-address: 91 rue Olivier de Serres, 75015 Paris, France

org-entry.found-date: 1923; incorporated, since 1961, an active section Aid to Believers in the Soviet Union
org-entry.content-note: in 1995 adopted a new Charter to reflect a broader membership to include all Orthodox religions
supports Christianity, in particular the Russian Orthodox Church, in the countries of the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics
organizes a summer camp

address.verbatim-address: Waiyaki Way, POB 14205, 00800 Westlands, Nairobi, Kenya

org-entry.content-note: an organ of co-operation and continuing fellowship among Protestant, Orthodox and independent churches and Christian Councils in Africa; 12th General Assembly: Abuja, Nigeria, in Nov. 2023
org-entry.stats: mems: 204 churches and affiliated Christian Councils in 42 African countries

address.verbatim-address: c/o St John’s Parish Office, Lansdowne Cres., London, W11 2NN, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: established to advance the Christian religion by encouraging mems of the Anglican and Eastern Church to learn more about each other, to facilitate scholarly discussion and mutual regard
functions under the patronage of the Ecumenical Patriarch and the Archbishop of Canterbury
organizes an annual Pilgrimage, an annual Constantinople Lecture, a summer Festival for mems
publ. Koinonia (3 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Bahá'í World Centre, POB 155, 31001 Haifa, Israel

org-entry.content-note: promotes and applies the principles of the Bahá’í faith, i.e. the abandonment of all forms of prejudice, the equality of women and men, recognition of the oneness of religion, the elimination of extremes of poverty and wealth, the realization of universal education and recognition that true religion is in harmony with reason and the pursuit of scientific knowledge, in order to contribute to the devt of a peaceful, just and sustainable society, and the resolution of the challenges currently facing humanity

Bahá’ís undertake to strengthen the moral and spiritual character of communities, for example by conducting classes that address the devt of children and channel the energies of young people, and initiating study groups

in some communities there is an annual election of a local council to administer affairs at that level; at national level there are elected governing councils; the head of the Bahá’í faith is the Universal House of Justice, a body of 9 mems elected by the 186 National Spiritual Assemblies
org-entry.stats: has more than 5m. followers, living in more than 100,000 localities; 180 nat. governing councils
org-entry.content-note: publs Bahá'í World News Service (online), One Country (quarterly, in 6 languages)

address.verbatim-address: 405 North Washington St, Falls Church, VA 22046, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to unite Baptists, lead in evan­gelism, respond to people in need, defend human rights, and promote theological reflection
World Congress held every 5 years (2025: Brisbane, Australia)
org-entry.stats: mems: 243 Baptist unions and conventions in 130 countries and territories, representing some 51m. individuals
org-entry.content-note: publ. The Baptist World (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: POB 876, Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

org-entry.content-note: governed by a General Assembly which meets every 5 years and appoints a 15-mem. Continuation Committee (board of management) to establish policies and direct the work of the org. between Assemblies
maintains subregional offices in Antigua, Jamaica and Trinidad
org-entry.stats: mems: 33 churches in 34 territories in the Dutch-, English-, French- and Spanish-speaking territories of the region

address.verbatim-address: c/o Payap University, Mueang, Chiang Mai 50000, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation and jt study in matters of common concern among the churches of the region and to encourage interaction with other regional confs and the World Council of Churches
Gen. Assembly normally held every 5 years (15th: Kottayam, India, in Sept.-Oct. 2023)
org-entry.stats: mems: 99 churches and 17 nat. councils

address.verbatim-address: Ecumenical Centre, 174 rue Joseph II, 1000 Brussels

org-entry.content-note: holds a General Assembly every 5 years (2023: Tallinn, Estonia, in June)
org-entry.stats: mems: 114 Protestant, Anglican, Orthodox and Old Catholic churches in all European countries, and 40 nat. council of churches and orgs
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , thematic studies, reports

address.verbatim-address: 114 Lavender St, 2-01 CT Hub 2, Singapore 338729

org-entry.found-date: 1977 (incorporating previous Congregational and Reform missionary societies)
org-entry.stats: mems: 32 church feds from Europe, Africa, the Caribbean and Asia and the Pacific
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , INSiGHT (every 2 months)

address.verbatim-address: Baptist House, Postjesweg 150, 1061 Amsterdam, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote fellowship and co-operation among Baptists in Europe
to further the aims and objects of the Baptist World Alliance
to stimulate and co-ordinate evangelism in Europe
to provide for consultation and planning of missionary work
org-entry.stats: mems: 54 unions and conventions, and 5 affiliated churches and networks in 52 countries

address.verbatim-address: Hertistr. 31, 8304 Wallisellen, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: established to promote understanding and co-operation among evangelical Christians in Europe and to stimulate evan­gelism
org-entry.stats: mems: 17 affiliates

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Federation of Jewish Communities of the CIS

address.verbatim-address: 445 Park Ave, 9th Floor, New York, NY 10022, USA

org-entry.content-note: established to restore Jewish society, culture and religion throughout the countries of the fmr Soviet Union through the provision of professional assistance, educational support and funding to mem. communities

address.verbatim-address: 173 Euston Rd, London, NW1 2AX, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage and strengthen the spiritual life within the Religious Society of Friends (Quakers)
to help Friends to a better understanding of their vocation in the world
and to promote consultation among Friends of all countries
representation at the UN as an NGO with general consultative status
org-entry.stats: mems: ap­pointed reps and individuals from 75 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Friends World News (2 a year), Calendar of Yearly Meetings , Quakers around the World (handbook)

address.verbatim-address: 15616 Copper Beech Dr., Upper Malboro, MD, 20774-8047, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1998 by the World Council of Churches
org-entry.content-note: aims to provide opportunities for representatives of all the main Christian traditions to meet, foster mutual respect and address common challenges
inaugural Global Forum was convened in Nov. 2007 in Limuru, near Nairobi, Kenya
3rd Forum was held in Bogotá, Colombia, in April 2018

address.verbatim-address: Essex Hall, 1-6 Essex St, London, WC2R 3HY, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: subscribes to the principle of openness and upholding the right to freedom of religion or belief
conducts multifaith religious freedom progs, focusing on inter-religious harmony
holds regional confs and a triennial congress
org-entry.stats: mems: 73 groups in 26 countries

address.verbatim-address: c/o Prof. T. J. F. Tillemans, Section des langues et civilisations orientales, Université de Lausanne, 1015 Lausanne, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: supports studies of Buddhist religion, philosophy and literature
holds international conf. every 3-4 years (2025: Leipzig, Germany, in Aug.)
publ. Journal of the International Association of Buddhist Studies (JIABS) (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council of Christians and Jews (ICCJ)

address.verbatim-address: Martin Buber House, POB 1129, 64629 Heppenheim, Germany

org-entry.content-note: organizes seminars, meetings for young people and for women, in order to promote mutual respect and co-operation
holds annual international conf. (2022: online, in June)
maintains a forum for Jewish-Christian-Muslim relations
org-entry.stats: mems: 34 nat. councils worldwide
org-entry.content-note: publs ICCJ History , ICCJ Brochure , conf. documents

address.verbatim-address: Prolongacion Bosques de Reforma 1592, Mexico City, 00110 Mexico

org-entry.found-date: 1912 to promote friendship and understanding among Jewish women throughout the world
org-entry.content-note: campaigns for human and women's rights, exchanges information on community welfare activities, promotes volunteer leadership, sponsors field work in social welfare, co-sponsors the International Jewish Women's Human Rights Watch and fosters Jewish education
org-entry.stats: mems: 34 affiliated orgs
org-entry.content-note: publ. ICJW Newsletter

address.verbatim-address: POB 1528, 3500 BM, Utrecht, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: international, spiritually based movement committed to active non-violence as a way of life and as a means of building a culture of peace and non-violence
maintains over 71 branches, affiliates and groups in more than 40 countries

publs IFOR in Action (quarterly), Patterns in Reconciliation (2 a year), International Reconciliation (3-4 a year), Cross the Lines (3 a year, in Arabic, English, French, Russian and Spanish), occasional paper series

address.verbatim-address: The Green House, 244-254 Cambridge Heath Rd, London, E2 9DA, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to bring into asscn all those interested in promoting ethical and scientific humanism and human rights
org-entry.stats: mems: humanist orgs and individuals in more than 50 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Organization for the Study of the Old Testament

address.verbatim-address: School of Divinity, History and Philosophy, King's College, University of Aberdeen, Aberdeen, AB24 3UB, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: holds triennial congresses (24th Congress: Zürich, Switzerland, in Aug. 2022)
publ. Vetus Testamentum (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Casilla 17-08-8522, Calle Inglaterra N. 32-113 y Mariana de Jesús, Quito, Ecuador

org-entry.stats: mems: some 150 churches in 21 countries

address.verbatim-address: Carrera 5 A 118-31, Apdo Aéreo 51086, Bogotá, Colombia

org-entry.content-note: co-ordinates church activities in and with the Latin American and the Caribbean Catholic Bishops’ Conferences
org-entry.stats: mems: 21 Episcopal Conferences of Central and South America and the Caribbean
org-entry.content-note: publ. Boletín (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: 150 route de Ferney, POB 2100, 1211 Geneva 2, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: provides inter-church aid and relief work in various areas of the globe
gives service to refugees, including resettlement
carries out theological research, advocates for human rights, organizes confs and exchanges
grants scholarship aid in various fields of church life
conducts interconfessional dialogue and conversation with the Anglican, Baptist, Methodist, Orthodox, Reformed, Roman Catholic and Seventh-day Adventist churches
org-entry.stats: mems: 149 Lutheran churches in 99 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Lutheran World Information (English and German, daily ­e-mail news service, online and monthly print edition), LWF Annual Report , LWF Documentation (in English and German), LWF Studies

address.verbatim-address: Makhoul St, Deeb Bldg, POB 5376, Beirut, Lebanon

org-entry.stats: mems: 27 churches
org-entry.content-note: publs MECC News Report (monthly), Al Montada Newsletter (quarterly, in Arabic), Courrier oecuménique du Moyen-Orient (quarterly)

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio mena sasia fea ass

address.verbatim-address: POB 537, Makkah, Saudi Arabia

org-entry.content-note: aims to ad­vance Islamic unity and solidarity, and to promote world peace and respect for human rights
provides financial assistance for education, medical care and relief work
in April 2020 donated US $1m. to the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees in the Near East

in Jan. 2024 launched a petition titled Peace for Gaza: Call for a Ceasefire; repeatedly denounced the targeting of civilians in the Gaza Strip, while calling on Hamas to release all hostages without conditions
org-entry.stats: 44 offices worldwide, 3 councils, 3 subsidiary bodies
org-entry.content-note: publs Al-Rabita Arabic , Muslim World League Journal (monthly, English and Arabic)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Prelature of the Holy Cross and Opus Dei

address.verbatim-address: Viale Bruno Buozzi 73, 00197 Rome, Italy

org-entry.content-note: established, by St Josemaría Escrivá de Balaguer, to spread, at every level of society, an increased awareness of the universal call to sanctity and apostolate in the exercise of one's work
org-entry.stats: mems: around 90,000, of whom around 2% are priests
org-entry.content-note: publ. Romana (Bulletin of the Prelature) (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: POB 208, 4 Thurston St, Suva, Fiji

org-entry.content-note: organizes assembly every 5 years (12th: Kanaky, New Caledonia, in Nov. 2023), as well as regular workshops, meetings and training seminars throughout the region
org-entry.stats: mems: 52 churches and councils in 19 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Pax Romana International Catholic Movement for Intellectual and Cultural Affairs (ICMICA); and International Movement of Catholic Students (IMCS)

address.verbatim-address: 3 rue de Varembé, 4th Floor, POB 161, 1211 Geneva 20, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage in mems an awareness of their responsibilities as people and Christians in the student and intellectual milieux
also aims to promote contacts between students and grad­uates throughout the world and co-ordinate the contribution of Catholic intellectual circles to international life
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 50 feds

address.verbatim-address: 777 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1970 to co-ordinate action of various world religions for world peace
org-entry.stats: mems: 90 nat. and 6 reg. interreligious councils
org-entry.content-note: publ. Newsletter

address.verbatim-address: International HQ, 101 Queen Victoria St, London, EC4V 4EH, United Kingdom

org-entry.found-date: 1865 to spread the Christian gospel and relieve poverty
org-entry.content-note: emphasis for mems is placed on the need for personal Christian discipleship
to enhance the effectiveness of its evangelism and non-discriminatory practical ministry it has adopted a quasi-military form of organization
social, medical, educational and emergency relief activities are also per­formed in the 130 countries where the Army operates
publs All the World (quarterly), Revive , Handbook of Doctrine , The Yearbook of the Salvation Army , Words of Life

address.verbatim-address: 6151 Commonwealth Dr., Loves Park, IL 61111, USA

org-entry.content-note: operates Regional Ministry Centres in Belarus, the Russian Fed. and Ukraine
sponsors bible and ministry training to church pastors and workers in CIS countries
provides Russian-language bibles and Christian literature
sponsors national missionary pastors, youth workers and children’s workers and helps provide food and humanitarian aid for distribution by local churches
publs Good News Report (monthly newsletter), Prayer and Praise (calendar)

address.verbatim-address: Blavatsky Ave, Adyar, Chennai 600 020, India

org-entry.content-note: aims at universal brotherhood, without distinction of race, creed, sex, caste or colour
promotes the study of comparative religion, philosophy and science, and the investigation of unexplained laws of nature and powers latent in man

organizes World Congress every 7-8 years (2025:
Vancouver, Canada, in July)
org-entry.stats: mems: 26,000 in 70 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs The Theoso­phist (monthly), Adyar News Letter (quarterly), Wake Up India ­(quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Union of Councils for Soviet Jews

address.verbatim-address: 1015 15th St, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, DC 20005, USA

org-entry.content-note: supports the Jewish community in the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) through bureaux in Moscow, St Petersburg, AlmatI, Bishkek, Lviv, Rīga, and Tbilisi
co-ordinates the Yad L'Yad partnership pro­g., linking Jewish communities in the former USSR with participating schools and synagogues in the USA
co-ordinates the translation, production and distribution of the Bible by Bible Societies worldwide
works with national Bible Societies to develop religious progs
org-entry.stats: mems: socs in more than 240 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs The Bible Translator (quarterly), Newsletter , Prayer Booklet (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society

address.verbatim-address: 900 Red Mills Rd, Wallkill, NY 12589-3223, USA

org-entry.stats: 89 branches
org-entry.content-note: serves as legal agency for Jehovah's Witnesses
publ. The Watchtower (in 188 languages)

address.verbatim-address: Borgo Santo Spirito 4, 00193 Rome, Italy

org-entry.found-date: 1953 as World Fed. of the Sodalities of our Lady
org-entry.content-note: established as a lay org. based on the teachings of Ignatius Loyola, to integrate Christian faith and daily living
org-entry.stats: mems: groups in 67 countries representing about 26,400 individuals
org-entry.content-note: publ. Progressio (in English, French and Spanish)

address.verbatim-address: Knochenhauerstr. 42, 30159 Hanover, Germany

org-entry.found-date: 2010 by merger of the World Alliance of Reformed Churches and the Reformed Ecumenical Council
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 232 churches in 108 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Reformed World (3 a year), Reformed Communiqué (3 a year)

org-entry.usage: casee eerca ass sacac sasia fea

address.verbatim-address: 150 route de Ferney, Postfach 2100, 1211 Geneva 2, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1948 to promote co-operation between Christian Churches and to prepare for a clearer manifestation of the unity of the Church
org-entry.content-note: activities are grouped under the following programmes: Unity, Mission and Ecumenical Relations; Public Witness and Diakonia ; and Ecumenical Formation
holds Assembly normally every 8 years; 11th Assembly: Karlsruhe, Germany, in Aug.-Sept. 2022
org-entry.stats: mems: 350 Churches in more than 110 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Current Dialogue (2 a year), Ecumenical Review (quarterly), International Review of Mission (quar­terly)

address.verbatim-address: 150 route de Ferney, Postfach 2100, 1211 Geneva 2, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1948 to promote co-operation between Christian Churches and to prepare for a clearer manifestation of the unity of the Church
org-entry.content-note: activities are grouped under the following programmes: Unity, Mission and Ecumenical Relations; Public Witness and Diakonia ; and Ecumenical Formation

in July 2020 the (acting) Gen. Sec. wrote formally to the Pres. of Türkiye (Turkey), Recep Tayyip Erdogan, stating WCC members’ grief and dismay over a decision to reconvert the Hagia Sophia museum in İstanbul into a mosque—following a recent Turkish legal ruling that Hagia Sophia (founded in 537 as a Christian cathedral, converted into a mosque in 1453, designated in 1934 as a secular museum, and also later included as part of the Historic Areas of İstanbul UNESCO World Heritage site) had been unlawfully repurposed in 1934; the Gen. Sec. emphasized the importance of inter-faith dialogue and expressed concern that the recent decision might aggravate divisions between religious communities
org-entry.stats: mems: 352 Churches in more than 110 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Current Dialogue (2 a year), Ecumenical Review (quarterly), International Review of Mission (quar­terly)

address.verbatim-address: Church Street Station, POB 3402, New York, NY 10008-3402, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1951 as World Evangelical Fellowship, on reorganization of World Evangelical Alliance (f. 1846), reverted to original name Jan. 2002
org-entry.content-note: an international grouping of national and regional bodies of evangelical Christians
encourages the organization of national fellowships and assists national mems in planning their activities
org-entry.stats: mems: 9 reg. asscns, 135 nat. evangelical asscns and more than 100 affiliates
org-entry.content-note: publ. Theological News (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 616 Benjasiri Pk, Soi Medhinivet off Soi Sukhumvit 24, Bangkok 10110, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: promotes strict observance and practice of the teachings of the Buddha
holds General Conference every 2 years (30th: Bangkok, in Oct. 2022)
org-entry.stats: 197 regional centres in 50 countries

address.verbatim-address: A- 6 d Jhilmil Industrial Area, Delhi 110095, India

org-entry.content-note: to promote and preserve Hindu philosophy and culture and to protect the rights of Hindus, particularly the right to worship; executive board meets annually
org-entry.stats: mems: in 45 countries and territories
org-entry.content-note: publ. Vishwa Hindu (monthly)
aims to foster the unity of the Jewish people and to advocate on their behalf, works to counter anti-semitism and to safeguard the legacy of the holocaust
org-entry.stats: mems: Jewish communities in over 100 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. The Cable (weekly)

address.verbatim-address: International Headquarters, POB 518, Lake Junaluska, NC 28745, USA

org-entry.content-note: established to deepen the fellowship of the Methodist peoples, encourage evangelism, foster Methodist participation in the ecumenical movement and promote the unity of Methodist witness and service
holds World Methodist Conference every 5 years (2024: Göteborg, Sweden, in Aug.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 80 churches in 132 countries, comprising 80m. individuals
org-entry.content-note: publ. First Friday Letter (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: Ecumenical Centre, POB 2100, 1211 Geneva 2, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to celebrate Christian faith in the academic community, and to present students with the claims of the faith over their whole life
has consultative status with the UN and advisory status at the World Council of Churches
holds General Assembly every 4 years (37th: Berlin, Germany, in June 2022)
org-entry.stats: mems: 2m.; 117 affiliated mems in 94 countries

address.verbatim-address: 6 Eliyahu Shama St, Jerusalem 9410806, Israel

org-entry.content-note: promotes and co-ordinates efforts of Reform, Liberal, Progressive and Reconstructionist congregations throughout the world
assigns and employs rabbis
sponsors seminaries and schools
maintains a youth section
org-entry.stats: mems: 1.8m. in around 50 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs News Updates , International Assembly Annual Reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Union of Catholic Women's Organisations

address.verbatim-address: Piazza di San Calisto 16, 00153 Rome, Italy

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote and co-ordinate the contribution of Catholic women in international life, in social, civic, cultural and religious matters
General Assembly held every 4-5 years (2023: Assisi, Italy in May)
org-entry.stats: mems: some 100 orgs representing in 50 countries representing more than 8m. women
org-entry.content-note: publ. Women’s Voice (quarterly, in 3 languages)
